bugs.title: CVE-2018-11099 vcftools: Heap-based buffer over-read in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-11099 vcftools: Heap-based buffer over-read in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-11099 vcftools: Heap-based buffer over-read in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor()

long_desc.thetext:
VCFtools through version 0.1.15 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() function. An attacker could exploit this to cause an information disclosure or denial of service.


External Reference:

http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2018/May/43

Created vcftools tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1580222]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1580223]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable

# Suggest that users restart after update

bugs.title: CVE-2018-11129 vcftools: Use after free in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-11129 vcftools: Use after free in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-11129 vcftools: Use after free in header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor()

long_desc.thetext:
VCFtools through version 0.1.15 is vulnerable to a use-after-free in the header.cpp:header::add_INFO_descriptor() function. An attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via crafted vcf file.


External Reference:

http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2018/May/43

Created vcftools tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2018-11130 vcftools: Use after free in headerp.cpp:header::add_FORMAT_descriptor() [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-11130 vcftools: Use after free in headerp.cpp:header::add_FORMAT_descriptor() [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-11130 vcftools: Use after free in headerp.cpp:header::add_FORMAT_descriptor()

long_desc.thetext:
VCFtools through version 0.1.15 is vulnerable to a use-after-free in the headerp.cpp:header::add_FORMAT_descriptor(). An attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via crafted vcf file.


External Reference:

http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2018/May/43

Created vcftools tracking bugs for this issue:
